etymology.description: 中(中) (zhōng, "middle") + 山(山) (shān, "mountain") form 中山(中山) (Zhōngshān, "Zhongshan") referring to Sun Yat-sen, a key figure in modern Chinese history. 區(區) (qū, "district") indicates an administrative division.
etymology.interpretation: 中山(中山) (Zhōngshān, "Zhongshan") commemorates Sun Yat-sen, known as the 'Father of the Nation' in Republic of China (Taiwan). 中山区(中山區) (Zhōngshān Qū, "Zhongshan District") in Taipei is named in his honor.

examples.chinese: 我住在中山区(我住在中山區)。
中山区是台北市的热门商业区(中山區是臺北市的熱門商業區)，生活节奏很快(生活節奏很快)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngshān Qū shì Táiběi shì de rè mén shāng yè qū，shēng huó jié zòu hěn kuài.
examples.english: Zhongshan District is a popular commercial area in Taipei, where life moves at a fast pace.
